conclusion: Plan to analyze the image and apply electromagnetic induction principles to find the potential difference.
The image shows a circular ring with radius R, moving at velocity v, entering a magnetic field with induction B. Angle ∠aOb is 90°.
The circular ring is made of uniform wire and moves at constant speed v into a uniform magnetic field.
As the ring moves, the magnetic flux changes, inducing an EMF in the ring.
EMF induced in a moving conductor in a magnetic field is given by EMF = B × l × v.
The length l is the circumference of the ring, which is 2πR.
The potential difference between points a and b is equal to the EMF induced in the ring.
Given ∠aOb is 90°, the potential difference is ΔV = B × 2πR × v.
The potential difference between points a and b is B × 2πR × v.
